docs.snippet: BROOK--Jonathan Edward. July 3, 2015. Devoted husband of Nicole, loving father of Juliette and Cassie, brother of Adam. Beloved son of Judith and David. A warm, loving, kind young man, who adored his family and cared for others. He made lasting an...
docs.lead_paragraph:
BROOK--Jonathan Edward.

July 3, 2015. Devoted husband of Nicole, loving father of Juliette and Cassie, brother of Adam. Beloved son of Judith and David. A warm, loving, kind young man, who adored his family and cared for others. He made lasting and deep friendships at Amherst College, class of 1992 and beyond. He will be missed by many.

docs.snippet: MIGUEL--Carmen, died in Wellesley, MA on July 2, 2015. Born in Puerto Montt, Chile on September 19, 1932, Carmen was a retired research editor for Life in Espanol and McCalls Magazine, and a long time lover of the opera and the arts in New York Ci...
docs.lead_paragraph: MIGUEL--Carmen, died in Wellesley, MA on July 2, 2015. Born in Puerto Montt, Chile on September 19, 1932, Carmen was a retired research editor for Life in Espanol and McCalls Magazine, and a long time lover of the opera and the arts in New York City. Carmen was a caring and devoted sister, aunt and friend. She will be profoundly missed by her loving family and friends in the U.S. and Chile. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to St. Ignatius Church, New York, NY. Mass on Wednesday, July 8 at 10:00am St. Paul's Parish, Wellesley, MA.

docs.snippet: MURRAY--Constance B. (Connie) Freedom Institute mourns the loss of Connie Murray, former Executive Director and President who, even after her retirement in 2009, served as a consultant and mentor to many. A dignified and compassionate person, she ...
docs.lead_paragraph:
MURRAY--Constance B.

(Connie) Freedom Institute mourns the loss of Connie Murray, former Executive Director and President who, even after her retirement in 2009, served as a consultant and mentor to many. A dignified and compassionate person, she left her mark on the field of recovery and on all those she helped. She is remembered for her sensitivity, insight and dedication to others, especially to educating adolescents about substance abuse prevention. Freedom Institute would not be what it is today without her. Connie will be dearly missed, but her legacy lives on at Freedom Institute and the memory of her kind smile, sharp wit and intelligent beauty remains in our hearts.

headline.main: South Korea Economy, Finance Policymakers Meet Over Greece
headline.print_headline: South Korea Economy, Finance Policymakers Meet Over Greece

docs.snippet: Senior South Korean economic and financial policymakers were meeting early on Monday to discuss the latest developments in financial markets after Greek voters rejected euro zone austerity measures, officials said....
docs.lead_paragraph: Senior South Korean economic and financial policymakers were meeting early on Monday to discuss the latest developments in financial markets after Greek voters rejected euro zone austerity measures, officials said.

headline.main: Argentine Opposition Set to Keep Buenos Aires City Hall
headline.print_headline: Argentine Opposition Set to Keep Buenos Aires City Hall

docs.snippet: Argentina's business-friendly PRO party won Sunday's mayoral election in the capital Buenos Aires by 20 percentage points, but failed to capture enough votes to avoid a run-off with the No. 2 contender later this month, official returns showed....
docs.lead_paragraph: Argentina's business-friendly PRO party won Sunday's mayoral election in the capital Buenos Aires by 20 percentage points, but failed to capture enough votes to avoid a run-off with the No. 2 contender later this month, official returns showed.

headline.main: U.S. Captain Lloyd Hits Final Hat-Trick in 16 Minutes
headline.print_headline: U.S. Captain Lloyd Hits Final Hat-Trick in 16 Minutes

docs.snippet: United States captain Carli Lloyd scored a hat-trick inside the opening 16 minutes of Sunday's 5-2 World Cup final win over Japan, enhancing her reputation for scoring in the biggest matches while making amends for a rare blemish in the 2011 final...

headline.main: Japan in Close Contact With Other Govts on Greece, Ready to Respond-Official
headline.print_headline: Japan in Close Contact With Other Govts on Greece, Ready to Respond-Official

docs.snippet: Japan is in close coordination with other governments on Greece's vote rejecting the terms of an economic bailout, and is ready to respond as appropriate, including in financial markets, a senior Japanese official said on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Japan is in close coordination with other governments on Greece's vote rejecting the terms of an economic bailout, and is ready to respond as appropriate, including in financial markets, a senior Japanese official said on Monday.
